books.title: Stand by for Mars!
books.author: Carey Rockwell
books.summary: Young Tom Corbett finally realizes his dream of becoming a Space Cadet but soon he and his classmates find themselves fighting to stay alive in the harsh Martian desert.

books.title: The Fur Country
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A group of colonists attempt to settle in the Arctic Circle.

books.title: The Autobiography of Calvin Coolidge
books.author: Calvin Coolidge
books.summary: The thirtieth president of the United States recounts his life story.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Pollyanna Grows Up
books.author: Eleanor H. Porter
books.summary: Pollyanna recovers from an automobile accident with the help of a nearby dowager, before leaving the country to later return to rural Vermont.

books.title: Figures of Earth
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: A young swineherd rises to the rank of Count by following his own thinking and desires.

books.title: The Man of Destiny
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Napoleon engages in a battle of wits to reclaim some stolen letters.

books.title: A Voyage to Arcturus
books.author: David Lindsay
books.summary: One man’s journey through a psychedelic alien landscape of philosophy, religion, life, and death.

books.title: The Beautiful and Damned
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: The marriage between a down-and-out aesthete and a self-indulgent flapper begins to crumble against the backdrop of World War I and America’s Jazz Age.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: The Middle Temple Murder
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: A murder in London’s Middle Temple uncovers a twenty year old conspiracy.

books.title: The New State
books.author: Mary Parker Follett
books.summary: The theory of group organization is formulated and applied in an attempt to design a truly democratic political state.

books.title: The Social Contract
books.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
books.summary: Rousseau explores the political philosophy of authority originating from the consent of the people.

books.title: Sonnets from the Portuguese
books.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
books.summary: A collection of 44 love sonnets.

books.title: Candide
books.author: Voltaire
books.summary: A witty satire that tells of the young Candide’s attempts to stay optimistic through a series of incredible hardships.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Robert Sheckley
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by Robert Sheckley ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Nella Larsen
books.summary: A collection of Nella Larsen’s short fiction by date of publication.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.
